1: <sup>1</sup> And the whole earth was of one language, and of one speech.
2: <sup>2</sup> And it came to pass, as they journeyed from the east, that they found a plain in the land of Shinar; and they dwelt there.
3: <sup>3</sup> And they said one to another, Go to, let us make brick, and burn them thoroughly. And they had brick for stone, and slime had they for morter.
4: <sup>4</sup> And they said, Go to, let us build us a city and a tower, whose top may reach unto heaven; and let us make us a name, lest we be scattered abroad upon the face of the whole earth.
5: <sup>5</sup> And the LORD came down to see the city and the tower, which the children of men builded.
6: <sup>6</sup> And the LORD said, Behold, the people is one, and they have all one language; and this they begin to do: and now nothing will be restrained from them, which they have imagined to do.
7: <sup>7</sup> Go to, let us go down, and there confound their language, that they may not understand one another’s speech.
8: <sup>8</sup> So the LORD scattered them abroad from thence upon the face of all the earth: and they left off to build the city.
9: <sup>9</sup> Therefore is the name of it called Babel; because the LORD did there confound the language of all the earth: and from thence did the LORD scatter them abroad upon the face of all the earth.
10: <sup>10</sup> These are the generations of Shem: Shem was an hundred years old, and begat Arphaxad two years after the flood:
11: <sup>11</sup> And Shem lived after he begat Arphaxad five hundred years, and begat sons and daughters.
12: <sup>12</sup> And Arphaxad lived five and thirty years, and begat Salah:
13: <sup>13</sup> And Arphaxad lived after he begat Salah four hundred and three years, and begat sons and daughters.
14: <sup>14</sup> And Salah lived thirty years, and begat Eber:
15: <sup>15</sup> And Salah lived after he begat Eber four hundred and three years, and begat sons and daughters.
16: <sup>16</sup> And Eber lived four and thirty years, and begat Peleg:
17: <sup>17</sup> And Eber lived after he begat Peleg four hundred and thirty years, and begat sons and daughters.
18: <sup>18</sup> And Peleg lived thirty years, and begat Reu:
19: <sup>19</sup> And Peleg lived after he begat Reu two hundred and nine years, and begat sons and daughters.
20: <sup>20</sup> And Reu lived two and thirty years, and begat Serug:
21: <sup>21</sup> And Reu lived after he begat Serug two hundred and seven years, and begat sons and daughters.
22: <sup>22</sup> And Serug lived thirty years, and begat Nahor:
23: <sup>23</sup> And Serug lived after he begat Nahor two hundred years, and begat sons and daughters.
24: <sup>24</sup> And Nahor lived nine and twenty years, and begat Terah:
25: <sup>25</sup> And Nahor lived after he begat Terah an hundred and nineteen years, and begat sons and daughters.
26: <sup>26</sup> And Terah lived seventy years, and begat Abram, Nahor, and Haran.
27: <sup>27</sup> Now these are the generations of Terah: Terah begat Abram, Nahor, and Haran; and Haran begat Lot.
28: <sup>28</sup> And Haran died before his father Terah in the land of his nativity, in Ur of the Chaldees.
29: <sup>29</sup> And Abram and Nahor took them wives: the name of Abram’s wife was Sarai; and the name of Nahor’s wife, Milcah, the daughter of Haran, the father of Milcah, and the father of Iscah.
30: <sup>30</sup> But Sarai was barren; she had no child.
31: <sup>31</sup> And Terah took Abram his son, and Lot the son of Haran his son’s son, and Sarai his daughter in law, his son Abram’s wife; and they went forth with them from Ur of the Chaldees, to go into the land of Canaan; and they came unto Haran, and dwelt there.
32: <sup>32</sup> And the days of Terah were two hundred and five years: and Terah died in Haran.
